sentences.sContent: Maria looked at him and laughed.
sentences.sCn: 玛丽亚看着他大笑起来。

sentences.sContent: Tony was laughing so hard he had to steady himself on the table.
sentences.sCn: 托尼笑得太厉害了，靠着桌子才能让自己站稳。

sentences.sContent: Nora laughed so much that she nearly cried.
sentences.sCn: 诺拉笑得眼泪都快出来了。

sentences.sContent: He couldn’t help it; he burst out laughing (= suddenly started laughing ).
sentences.sCn: 他情不自禁地放声大笑起来。

sentences.sContent: He’s one of the few writers who can make me laugh out loud.
sentences.sCn: 有几位作家能让我放声大笑，他是其中之一。

phrases.pCn: v. 笑在最后；取得最后胜利
[美国俚语]为了取乐，当作消遣，借以开心
不信任的嘲笑；大声狂笑；哈哈大笑
用笑驱除恐惧等；付之一笑；谈笑中消磨时间

words.tran: 笑者；好笑的一边倒比赛

trans.tranOther: to make sounds with your voice, usually while you are smiling, because you think something is funny
the act of laughing or the sound you make when you laugh
